name: 1tracker Instrument
summary: Learn about .1TI files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: 1tracker is a chiptune music tracker that allows users to create, edit, and export audio that sounds like 1-bit video game music. While creating songs, users can apply different instruments to each of those songs' included channels. Instruments modify how 1tracker plays the notes that a channel contains.

To create, load, and apply instruments, users press F4 to access 1tracker's Instrument Editor. There, users can cycle between a song's included instruments and modify any instrument's Length and Threshold settings. They can then save the instrument they've created as a 1TI file (by pressing F2), so they can quickly import it into and apply it to other channels, including those in other 1tracker modules (.1TM files).

description: A 1TI file is an instrument specification used by 1tracker, a music tracker for Windows and Linux. It defines an instrument's note length and threshold. 1tracker users can create and load 1TI files in the program's Instrument Editor.

instructions: You can open a 1TI file with 1tracker (Windows, Linux). To do so, open 1tracker and then press F4 to access the Instrument Editor. Then, press F3 to load and apply your 1TI file.

images.alt: Screenshot of a .1ti file in Shiru 1tracker
images.caption: 1TI file open in Shiru 1tracker
